business.name: Business & Professional
business.description: Frameworks optimized for business and professional contexts

creativi.name: Creative & Marketing
creativi.description: Tools for creative content, marketing and communication

avanzati.description: Complex frameworks for specialized and multi-agent tasks

problem-solving.name: Problem Solving
problem-solving.description: Structured methodologies for solving complex problems

ape.title: APE
ape.description: Three-step structure (Action, Purpose, Expectation) ideal for beginners and content creation
ape.explanation: APE (Action-Purpose-Expectation) is one of the simplest and most accessible frameworks. It consists of three elements: Action (what you want the AI to do), Purpose (why you're asking), Expectation (expected result). It's perfect for getting started with prompt engineering because it's intuitive and covers the essential basics.
ape.example:
Action: Write a blog article
Purpose: To explain to beginners what prompt engineering is
Expectation: 500-word article, accessible tone, with 3 practical examples

aida.title: AIDA
aida.description: Marketing formula (Attention, Interest, Desire, Action) adapted for prompt engineering
aida.explanation: AIDA is a classic marketing framework adapted for prompt engineering. Attention (capture attention), Interest (generate interest), Desire (create desire), Action (drive to action). It's ideal for persuasive content, advertising copy and communication that needs to convert.
aida.example:
Attention: "78% of startups fail within the first 3 years"
Interest: "But those using AI for marketing are 3x more likely to succeed"
Desire: "Imagine automating your content creation saving 20 hours per week"
Action: "Download our free AI Marketing Toolkit guide now"

bab.title: BAB
bab.description: Before-After-Bridge structure for presenting scenarios and connected solutions
bab.explanation: BAB (Before-After-Bridge) is perfect for presenting problems and solutions. Before describes the current situation/problem, After shows the desired result, Bridge explains how to get there. Excellent for pitches, case studies and persuasive storytelling.
bab.example:
Before: The marketing team spends 15 hours/week creating social content manually
After: The team reduces time to 3 hours/week while maintaining superior quality
Bridge: By implementing an AI content generation system with custom templates

care.title: CARE
care.description: Context, Action, Result, Example for providing context and clear examples
care.explanation: CARE emphasizes the importance of complete context. Context (situation and background), Action (what to do), Result (desired outcome), Example (concrete example). Great when precision is needed and when the task requires deep understanding of context.
care.example:
Context: I'm a SaaS startup founder in the HR tech sector, targeting Italian SMEs
Action: Write a cold outreach email for HR managers
Result: Response rate of at least 15%, conversation toward demo
Example: Similar to [insert example of effective email you've seen]

coast.title: COAST
coast.description: Context, Objective, Audience, Style, Tone for business and creative work
coast.explanation: COAST is a complete framework for professional content creation. Context (background), Objective (specific purpose), Audience (precise target), Style (format and structure), Tone (voice and personality). Ideal for creative briefs and corporate communication.
coast.example:
Context: Launch of new SaaS product for project management
Objective: Generate 500 qualified leads in 30 days
Audience: Project managers at tech companies with 50-200 employees, ages 30-45
Style: Landing page with hero section, 3 benefits, social proof, CTA
Tone: Professional but modern, data-driven, results-oriented

costar.title: COSTAR
costar.description: Complete framework for prompt writing as a full-stack design challenge
costar.explanation: COSTAR is the most complete framework: Context, Objective, Style, Tone, Audience, Response format. It's the gold standard for complex tasks in professional contexts. Requires more effort but produces superior results when maximum precision is needed.
costar.example:
Context: B2B SaaS analytics product launch in competitive market
Objective: Position ourselves as innovative leader, generate 1000 trials in Q1
Style: Long-form content marketing, data-driven, storytelling
Tone: Authoritative but accessible, tech-forward, human
Audience: C-level and VP Analytics at Fortune 1000 companies
Response: Series of 4 articles, 2000 words, structure: hook-data-case study-CTA

calibro.title: CALIBRO
calibro.description: Innovative modular framework for LLMs - Context, Actor, Limits, Intention, Breakdown, Rules, Observation
calibro.explanation: CALIBRO is an innovative and pragmatic prompting framework that adapts to different LLMs. Each letter corresponds to a block designed to validate and compose optimal prompts: Context & Corpus, Actor & Audience, Limits & Constraints, Intention & Criteria, Breakdown & Procedure, Rules of Style & Format, Observation & Evaluation. Ideal for projects requiring maximum precision and traceability.
calibro.example:
C — Context & Corpus: "Analyze Q3 2024 financial report (sections 1-4, excluding appendices). Focus on operating margins and cash flow."

A — Actor & Audience: "Act as a senior CFO. Target: non-financial board members, 10-minute presentation."

L — Limits & Constraints: "Only data from provided document. No speculation on Q4. Maximum analysis time: 5 minutes."

I — Intention & Criteria: "Objective: identify 3 main risks with quantified impact. Success: each risk with precise figures."

B — Breakdown & Procedure: "1) Extract KPIs → 2) Compare with Q2 → 3) Identify anomalies → 4) Quantify impacts → 5) Draft summary."

R — Rules of Style & Format: "Output: JSON with keys {executive_summary: string, risks: [{name, impact_eur, probability}], confidence: 0-1}."

O — Observation & Evaluation: "If insufficient data, ask max 2 clarifications. If confidence < 0.7, add methodological notes."

craft.title: CRAFT
craft.description: Context, Role, Action, Format, Target - structured methodology for complete prompts
craft.explanation: CRAFT stands for Context, Role, Action, Format, Target. Professional framework for creating extremely detailed and complete prompts that leave no room for doubt. Includes situational context, expert role, sequential actions, output format and target audience. Perfect for generating superior quality prompts.
craft.example:
CONTEXT: B2B SaaS company wanting to create educational content to increase engagement and demo requests.

ROLE: You are an expert content marketing strategist with over 20 years of experience in the B2B SaaS sector.

ACTION:
1. Analyze the target audience and identify main pain points
2. Create a 3-month content strategy with SMART goals
3. Propose 10 topic ideas with keyword research

FORMAT: Strategic document in tabular format.

TARGET: Marketing managers at tech SMEs (50-200 employees).

crispe.title: CRISPE
crispe.description: Capacity, Insight, Statement, Personality, Experiment - define AI role and personality
crispe.explanation: CRISPE emphasizes AI role-playing. Capacity/Role (expertise and role), Insight (background knowledge), Statement (specific task), Personality (tone and style), Experiment (iteration). Perfect for outputs requiring specific expertise and defined personality.
crispe.example:
Capacity: You are a senior marketing strategist with 15 years of B2B SaaS experience
Insight: You know growth hacking, PLG (Product-Led Growth), marketing automation
Statement: Create a go-to-market strategy for AI analytics product launch
Personality: Direct, data-driven, ROI-focused, pragmatic
Experiment: Propose 3 strategic variants with pros/cons of each

chain-of-thought.title: Chain of Thought
chain-of-thought.description: Guide the model to reason step by step to reach a solution
chain-of-thought.explanation: Chain of Thought (CoT) dramatically improves response quality for complex tasks. Instead of asking for the answer directly, you guide the model to 'think out loud', showing each logical step. Fundamental for math, logic, problem solving.
chain-of-thought.example:
Problem: Calculate the ROI of a marketing campaign
Budget: €10,000
Results: 500 leads, 50 conversions, average customer value €1,200

Think step by step:
1. Calculate generated revenue
2. Subtract the cost
3. Divide profit by cost
4. Convert to percentage
5. Interpret the result

crafting-ai.title: CRAFTING AI
crafting-ai.description: Extension of CRAFT with validation and continuous refinement phases
crafting-ai.explanation: CRAFTING AI extends CRAFT by adding iteration and validation. Includes testing, feedback and refinement phases. Ideal for complex projects requiring multiple iterations and continuous optimization.
crafting-ai.example:
Context: Developing customer service chatbot for e-commerce
Request: Bot handling returns, tracking, product FAQs
Action: Design conversations, error handling, human escalation
Format: Flow diagram + conversation scripts + KPIs
Target: Italian customers, all tech literacy levels

--- ITERATION LOOP ---
1. Generate first version
2. Identify 3-5 test scenarios
3. Validate output
4. List improvements
5. Generate improved version

few-shot.title: Few-Shot Learning
few-shot.description: Provide 2-5 examples to teach the model the desired pattern
few-shot.explanation: Few-Shot Learning is extremely powerful for specific tasks. Provide 2-5 examples of the desired output format before the actual request. The model will learn the pattern and replicate it. Extremely effective for tasks with specific formatting.

grade.title: GRADE
grade.description: Goal, Request, Action, Detail, Examples for clear objectives
grade.explanation: GRADE emphasizes clarity of objectives. Goal (final objective), Request (specific request), Action (what to do), Detail (specifics), Examples (examples). Great for tasks with well-defined objectives.
grade.example:
Goal: Increase social media engagement by 50%
Request: Create an editorial calendar for 30 days
Action: Plan posts for LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram
Detail: 3 posts/day, mix of educational and promotional content
Examples: Tutorial posts, infographics, case studies

par.title: PAR
par.description: Problem, Action, Result - simple structure for problem solving
par.explanation: PAR is a minimalist but effective framework. Problem (define the problem), Action (what to do to solve it), Result (expected outcome). Perfect for simple tasks that don't require complex structures.
par.example:
Problem: The website has a 0.5% conversion rate
Action: Analyze UX and propose 5 improvements
Result: Increase conversion rate to 2%

race.title: RACE
race.description: Role, Action, Context, Example for tasks with defined role
race.explanation: RACE puts the role first. Role (who is the AI), Action (what to do), Context (situation), Example (output example). Useful when the AI's role is crucial for output quality.
race.example:
Role: You are a senior copywriter specialized in B2B tech
Action: Write 5 headlines for LinkedIn campaign
Context: AI product launch for HR analytics
Example: "AI that transforms HR data into strategic decisions"

rascef.title: RASCEF
rascef.description: Role, Action, Steps, Context, Example, Format for procedural tasks
rascef.explanation: RASCEF adds Steps to the RACE framework. Perfect for tasks requiring step-by-step procedures. Also includes Format to specify output structure.
rascef.example:
Role: Senior data analyst
Action: Create quarterly sales report
Steps: 1) Extract data 2) Calculate KPIs 3) Identify trends 4) Recommendations
Context: Fashion e-commerce, Q3 2024
Example: Report with graphs and tables
Format: PDF with executive summary + detail

rhodes.title: RHODES
rhodes.description: Role, How, Objective, Details, Examples, Sense-check for complex tasks
rhodes.explanation: RHODES is a complete framework that includes self-verification. Role, How (methodology), Objective, Details, Examples, Sense-check (logic verification). Ideal for critical tasks requiring validation.
rhodes.example:
Role: Strategy consultant
How: Use SWOT and Porter's Five Forces frameworks
Objective: SaaS market competitive analysis
Details: Focus on 5 direct competitors
Examples: Include sector case study
Sense-check: Verify data and conclusion consistency

roses.title: ROSES
roses.description: Role, Objective, Scenario, Expected Solution, Short form
roses.explanation: ROSES is great for specific scenarios. Role, Objective, Scenario (detailed situation), Expected Solution, Short form (summary). Perfect for simulations and case studies.
roses.example:
Role: Tech startup CEO
Objective: Decide funding strategy
Scenario: Series A vs bootstrapping, 18-month runway
Expected Solution: Pros/cons of both options
Short form: Recommendation in 3 bullet points

rtf.title: RTF
rtf.description: Role, Task, Format - minimalist but effective framework
rtf.explanation: RTF is the simplest and fastest framework. Role (who), Task (what), Format (how). Perfect for quick tasks that don't require elaborate context.
rtf.example:
Role: SEO expert
Task: Optimize this meta description
Format: Max 160 characters, include main keyword

smart.title: SMART
smart.description: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound for objectives
smart.explanation: SMART applies classic goal-setting criteria to prompting. Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound. Perfect for defining clear and measurable objectives.
smart.example:
Specific: Create 10 LinkedIn posts
Measurable: Engagement rate > 5%
Achievable: Content based on existing expertise
Relevant: Supports new product launch
Time-bound: Delivery by Friday

sparc.title: SPARC
sparc.description: Situation, Problem, Action, Result, Context for structured problem solving
sparc.explanation: SPARC is ideal for problem solving. Situation (current state), Problem (specific challenge), Action (what to do), Result (outcome), Context (additional information). Robust framework for analytical tasks.
sparc.example:
Situation: E-commerce with 10K visitors/month
Problem: 80% cart abandonment rate
Action: Analyze and propose 5 solutions
Result: Reduce abandonment to 60%
Context: Target millennials, tech products

spear.title: SPEAR
spear.description: Situation, Problem, Explanation, Action, Result for causal analysis
spear.explanation: SPEAR adds Explanation to understand causes. Situation, Problem, Explanation (why it happens), Action, Result. Great when you need to understand the "why" before acting.
spear.example:
Situation: Newsletter with 50K subscribers
Problem: Open rate dropped from 25% to 15%
Explanation: Analyze possible causes
Action: Propose recovery plan
Result: Return to 25% in 3 months

star.title: STAR
star.description: Situation, Task, Action, Result - classic framework for storytelling
star.explanation: STAR is the classic framework for telling stories and case studies. Situation (context), Task (challenge), Action (what you did), Result (outcome). Perfect for portfolios and presentations.
star.example:
Situation: Early-stage startup with no marketing budget
Task: Generate 1000 leads in 3 months
Action: Content marketing + strategic partnerships
Result: 1500 leads, 50 paying customers

tag.title: TAG
tag.explanation: TAG is the most essential framework. Task (what), Action (how), Goal (why). Perfect for quick prompts when context is already clear.
tag.example:
Task: Rewrite this paragraph
Action: Make it more concise and professional
Goal: Convince investors in pitch deck

trace.title: TRACE
trace.description: Task, Request, Action, Context, Example for professional tasks
trace.explanation: TRACE is a balanced framework for professional tasks. Task, Request (specific), Action, Context, Example. Provides enough structure without being too complex.
trace.example:
Task: Write a business proposal
Request: For AI consulting service
Action: Include executive summary, scope, pricing
Context: Enterprise client, €100K+ budget
Example: Follow attached template

tree-of-thoughts.title: Tree of Thoughts
tree-of-thoughts.description: Explore multiple reasoning paths in parallel and choose the best
tree-of-thoughts.explanation: Tree of Thoughts extends Chain of Thought by exploring multiple paths. Instead of a single linear reasoning, it explores multiple routes, evaluates each and chooses the best. Ideal for complex decisions with multiple possible solutions.
tree-of-thoughts.example:
Problem: How to increase sales by 30%?

Path 1: Pricing optimization
→ Pros: Immediate, controllable
→ Cons: Risk of margin reduction

Path 2: Channel expansion
→ Pros: New segments
→ Cons: High initial investment

Path 3: Product improvement
→ Pros: Lasting added value
→ Cons: Long development time

Evaluation: Path 1 best for quick wins

traci.title: TRACI
traci.description: Task, Role, Audience, Create, Intent for content creation
traci.explanation: TRACI is optimized for content creation. Task, Role, Audience, Create (content type), Intent (purpose). Perfect for social media and marketing content.
traci.example:
Task: LinkedIn post
Role: AI thought leader
Audience: CTOs and tech leaders
Create: 10-slide carousel
Intent: Generate leads for webinar

crip.title: CRIP
crip.description: Context, Role, Instructions, Parameters for technical tasks
crip.explanation: CRIP is oriented toward technical tasks. Context, Role, Instructions (detailed), Parameters (technical constraints). Great for coding, data analysis, tasks with precise requirements.
crip.example:
Context: REST API for e-commerce
Role: Senior backend developer
Instructions: Implement checkout endpoint
Parameters: Node.js, PostgreSQL, max latency 200ms

react.title: ReAct
react.description: Reasoning and Acting - combines reasoning with concrete actions
react.explanation: ReAct alternates reasoning and action. The model thinks, acts, observes the result, thinks again. Very powerful for tasks requiring interaction with the environment or iterative decisions.
react.example:
Thought: I need to find the average house price in Milan
Action: Search[average house price Milan 2024]
Observation: €4,500/sqm in the center
Thought: Now I calculate the budget for 80sqm
Action: Calculate[4500 * 80]
Observation: €360,000
Final: Estimated budget €360,000

t-rex.title: T-REX
t-rex.description: Task, Requirements, Examples, eXecution for structured tasks
t-rex.explanation: T-REX emphasizes requirements and examples. Task, Requirements (specific), Examples (concrete), eXecution (action plan). Great when there are precise technical requirements.
t-rex.example:
Task: Develop landing page
Requirements: Mobile-first, < 3s load time, WCAG 2.1
Examples: Reference to competitors X and Y
eXecution: 1) Wireframe 2) Design 3) Dev 4) Test

zero-shot.title: Zero-Shot
zero-shot.explanation: Zero-Shot is the most direct prompting: ask for something without providing examples. Works well for generic tasks where the model already has the necessary knowledge. Fast but less precise for specific tasks.
zero-shot.example: Write a professional email to request a meeting with a potential client in the B2B tech sector.

prisma.title: PRISMA
prisma.description: Ultimate meta-framework combining ReAct, Tree of Thoughts, CALIBRO and CRAFT
prisma.explanation: PRISMA is the most advanced framework, designed for maximum complexity tasks. Combines the strength of ReAct (iterative reasoning), Tree of Thoughts (parallel exploration), CALIBRO (enterprise modularity) and CRAFT (professional structure). Includes self-evaluation and continuous refinement.
prisma.example:
--- PRISMA EXECUTION ---

[P]REPARATION:
Task: GTM strategy for AI product
Constraints: €50K budget, 6 months

[R]EASONING:
Thought 1: I identify 3 possible approaches
Path A: Product-led growth
Path B: Sales-led
Path C: Partnership

[I]TERATION:
Pros/cons analysis for each path

[S]ELECTION:
Choice: Path A (PLG) with elements of C

[M]ODELING:
CALIBRO blueprint for implementation

[A]CTION:
Detailed execution plan

bcm.title: BCM
bcm.description: Multi-Style Creative Brief with integrated self-evaluation
bcm.explanation: BCM (Multi-Style Creative Brief) is a specialized framework for copywriting and content marketing. Automatically generates multiple stylistic variants of the same content and includes self-evaluation to identify the best version.
bcm.example:
--- BCM EXECUTION ---

BRIEF: Landing page for AI writing tool

STYLE 1 - Professional:
"Transform your content marketing with AI"

STYLE 2 - Provocative:
"Is your human copywriter obsolete?"

STYLE 3 - Emotional:
"Free your creativity from operational tasks"

SELF-EVALUATION:
Style 2: Highest engagement potential
Style 1: Safest for B2B enterprise
Style 3: Best for creative agencies
